title: Northern Tamil Nadu Jain Tirths
author: Chirag Jain
description: A pilgrimage through the ancient Jain heritage sites of Northern Tamil Nadu, including mountain temples and rock-cut shrines.

stops.name: Shree Kshetra Arihantagiri
stops.description: Major pilgrimage center located 230 km from Bangalore. A gurukul is also being run by the trust for young students, with a large temple complex.

stops.name: Arihanthgiri Ancient Mountain Temples
stops.description: Features 3-4 temples, 18-foot ancient idol of Neminatha, Samadhi Sthal of Acharya Shri Samantabhadra and Pandava Caves.

stops.name: Arani Saidapet Jain Temple
stops.description: Located 19 km from Arihanthgiri.

stops.name: Shri 1008 Bhagwan Adinath Digambar Jain Temple, Arani
stops.description: Another significant Digambar Jain temple in Arani.

stops.name: Poondi Ponezhil Nathar Digamber Jain (Arugar) Temple
stops.description: Ancient Jain temple located in Poondi, 6 kms from Arani

stops.name: Ancient Jain Temple Munigiri, Karandai
stops.description: Historical temple site located 45 km from Poondi. With a magnificent seated idol of 1008 Kuntunatha Bhagavan, finished in a radiant golden hue, this place also has the honour of being tapasthali of Acharya Shri Akalank Swamy.

stops.name: Thiruppanamoor Digambar Jain Temple, Karandai
stops.description: With moolnayak as Bhagwan Pushpadantnath, this temple is just 1 km from Munigiri temple, Karandai.

stops.name: Thiruparuthikundram Sri Digambar Jain Temples, Kanchivaram
stops.description: Important Jain heritage site in Kanchivaram, 20 kms from Karandai.

stops.name: Ponnur Malai Dharmshala
stops.description: Night stay featuring 2 temples.

stops.name: Acharya Kund Kund Charan, Ponnur Hill
stops.description: The sacred ancient footprints of Acharya Kund Kund.

stops.name: Sri Adinath Digamber Jain Temple, Ponnur Malai
stops.description: Includes 3-4 other temples at the site.

stops.name: Thirakoil Jain Hill
stops.description: Contains rock-cut cave temples on the hill and at the base, 8 kms from Ponnur Malai.

stops.name: Ariyampoondi Rock Cut Mahavir Jain Temple
stops.description: An ancient rock-cut temple dedicated to Bhagwan Mahavir, 6 kms from Ponnur Malai.

stops.name: Sri 1008 Adinath Digambar Jain Temple, Ponnur
stops.description: Local Adinath temple in the Ponnur city, 12 kms from Ariyampoondi.

stops.name: Ancient Bhagwan Adinath Temple, Salukkai
stops.description: A 2300-year-old ancient temple site, 16 kms from Ponnur city.

stops.name: 1008 Bhagavan Sri Adinath Digambar Jain Basadi, Vizhukkam
stops.description: Digambar Jain temple located 40 kms from Salukkai.

stops.name: Mel Chitamur (Jin Kanchi)
stops.description: The administrative center (Jin Kanchi) of the Tamil Jain community, 7 kms from Vizhukkam. It features a seven-storeyed Raja Gopuram, a 52-foot manastambha, and a 14-foot black idol of Parshvanatha.

stops.name: Thirunathan Kundru Jain Hill, Gingee
stops.description: An ancient Jain hill site near Mel Chitamur, 15 kms from Mel Chitamur.

title: Mysuru, Sravanabelgola & Gommatgiri Tour
author: Chirag Jain
description: A classic journey to the world-famous Gommateshwara statue and historic sites of Southern Karnataka.

stops.name: Shri Aadinath Digambar Jain Temple, Srirangapatna
stops.description: An ancient temple located 150 kms from Bangalore.

stops.name: Shri Parshwanath Digambar Jain Temple and Jain Boarding Dharmashala, Mysuru
stops.description: Mysuru is just 11 kms from Srirangapatna. Visit the local temple and explore Mysuru palace.

stops.name: Gommatgiri
stops.description: Small hillock with an ancient 16-feet statue of Bahubali, located 24 kms from Mysuru.

stops.name: Shri Baahubali Theertha, Kaaveri Dhaama, (Basadi Hosakote)
stops.description: A peaceful temple and a nice viewpoint on the banks of the river Kaveri, located 40 kms from Gommatgiri.

stops.name: Assam Bhavan, Sravanabelgola
stops.description: 50 kms from Kaaveri Dhaam. Comfortable stay with AC rooms available. Can also go for 'Vidyanand Nilaya' for a cheaper stay or in case if this dharmshala is full. Bhojanshala is located near jain mutt temple.

stops.name: Chandragiri Hill, Sravanbelgola
stops.description: Site of 15 ancient temples, the Samadhi cave of Acharya Bhadrabahu and charan of Muni Chandragupta.

stops.name: Vindhyagiri Hill, Sravanabelgola
stops.description: Home to the popular massive monolithic idol of Bahubali Swamy, built during the 10th century.

stops.name: Jain Mutt Temple, Sravanabelgola
stops.description: Darshan, followed by lunch at the nearby Bhojanshala. There are 4-5 more temples in the town.

stops.name: Jinnathpuram
stops.description: An ancient Jain pilgrimage site, just 2 kms from Sravanabelgola. 2 temples - Shri Parshwanath Basadi and Shri Shantinath Basadi are located here.

stops.name: Kambadahalli Jain Mutt
stops.description: Located 20 kms from Sravanabelgola, a 2000-year-old temple complex and gurukul run by the trust for young kids.

stops.name: Shri Paras Dham Atishay Kshetra
stops.description: Located just 24 kms from Kambadahalli, on the way to bangalore.

stops.name: Mandargiri Hill
stops.description: Located 90 kms from Paras Dham. Features a unique Samosharan temple and a scenic lake viewpoint on the hill (you can either climb or use your vehicle). On the base, there is a 21 feet monolithic idol of Shri Chandraprabhu Swamy and a pichhi shaped guru mandir.

title: West Karnataka Coastal Pilgrimage
author: Chirag Jain
description: A journey through the coastal Jain belt featuring several Bahubali monoliths. The pilgrimage starts from Mangalore and ends at Humcha (near Arasalu station).

stops.name: Shri Digambar Jain Temple, Mangaluru
stops.description: Ancient temple located near Mangalore Central station.

stops.name: Saavira Kambada Basadi, Moodbadri
stops.description: Famous '1000-pillar temple' along with 17 other ancient temples (most temples are open only from 7 AM to 10 AM), get map from the jain mathada basadi. If bhojanshala is closed for some reason, you can go to Arihanth Ahaar restaurant for jain food.

stops.name: Vennoor Bahubali
stops.description: A historic monolithic statue of Bahubali Swamy, 20 kms from Moodbadri. There is another temple behind the Bahubali statue.

stops.name: Adinath Swamy Basadi, Vennoor
stops.description: Located within 1 km of the Vennoor Bahubali statue.

stops.name: Dharmasthala Bahubali
stops.description: Located 32 kms from Vennoor, has a modern monolith of Bahubali Swamy with a dedicated Jain dining hall. There is another jain temple in the town.

stops.name: Ratnatraya Basadi Atishay Kshetra
stops.description: Located 23 kms from Dharmasthala, a sacred site offering night stay facilities.

stops.name: Karkala Bahubali
stops.description: Located 45 kms from Ratnatraya Basadi, it houses an ancient monolith of Bahubali Swamy. Out of 23 temples in the town, 12 temples are ancient - Chaturmukha Basadi and Annekere Basadi (lake temple) being some of them. The Kshetra is about 1000 year old and famous for sculptures.

stops.name: Chaturmukh Basadi, Karkala
stops.description: Unique four-faced architectural marvel of Karkala.

stops.name: Varanga Lake Jain Temple
stops.description: A beautiful temple situated in the middle of a lake, 27 kms from Karkala. A serene 12th-century, four-faced (Chaturmukha) temple located in the middle of a 14-acre lake in Varanga village, Udupi district, Karnataka. Dedicated to Parshwanatha, this 850-year-old temple is accessed by a 100-meter boat ride, featuring intricate, star-shaped architecture surrounded by water lilies and lush nature.

stops.name: Kundadri Shri Parshwanath Basadi
stops.description: Just 44 kms from Varanga, this place is known for being the tapasthali of Acharya Shri Kund Kund Swamy.

stops.name: Jwalamalini Atishay Kshetra, N R Pura
stops.description: Prominent temple dedicated to Yakshini Jwalamalini and Shri Chandraprabha Swamy, located 58 kms from Kundadri.

stops.name: Humcha Jain Temple
stops.description: Major pilgrimage center for Padmavati Devi and Shri Parshwanath Bhagwan. Located 55 kms from Jwalamalini Atishay Kshetra.

title: Bundelkhand Digambar Jain Yatra
author: Chirag Jain
description: A deep exploration of Jainism in Madhya Pradesh, including the magnificent Kundalpur Bade Baba and Ramtek. The pilgrimage starts from Nagpur and ends at Jabalpur

stops.name: Ramtek Jain Temples
stops.description: With moolnayak as golden colored idol of Shri Shantinath Bhagwan in kayotsarga posture, it is located 50 kms from Nagpur (buses and autos available from Nagpur). There are also 8 other temples in the complex. The place also has centre for Pratibhasthali (gurukul for jain girls) and Hathkargha.

stops.name: Seoni Bada Mandir
stops.description: Historical temple in Seoni, 80 kms from Ramtek.

stops.name: Chhapara Jain Mandir
stops.description: Historical temple in Chhapara, 36 kms from Seoni.

stops.name: Lakhnadaun Jain Mandir (Samnapur Jinalay)
stops.description: 26 kms from Chhapara.

stops.name: Pisanhari ki Madhiya Ji, Jabalpur
stops.description: 80 kms from Lakhnadaun. Scenic temples, both on hill and in the campus, with full stay and food facilities.

stops.name: Shasanoday Tirth, Hanumantal, Jabalpur
stops.description: The most ancient idol of Shri Aadinath Bhagwan. For lunch, you can either visit Madhiya Ji Bhojanshala, or try Padharo Sa Jain Restaurant.

stops.name: Koni Ji Atishay Kshetra, Paatan
stops.description: Located 38 kms from Jabalpur. Main idol is of vighnahar Chintamani Parasnathaji and 9 other temples.

stops.name: Beena Baarah Atishay Kshetra
stops.description: Located 80 kms from Koni Ji. Moolnayak bhagwan is Shri Shantinath Ji. Significant pilgrimage site with many ancient idols located in a large temple complex. The place has a large goshala and a centre for hathkargha.

stops.name: Patnaganj Jinalay, Rehli
stops.description: Located 38 kms from Beena Baarah. Moolnayak is Shri Mahavir Bhagwan.

stops.name: Pateriya Ji Atishay Kshetra, Garhakota
stops.description: Located 25 kms from Rehli. Moolnayak bhagwan is Shri Parshwanath Ji.

stops.name: Shri Bade Baba, Kundalpur
stops.description: Located 70 kms from Garhakota. The massive idol of Adinath Bhagwan (Bade Baba) and 63 other temples located on the hill. This place is a Sidhh Kshetra, where shridhar kevali attained moksha.

stops.name: Kundalpur Parvat Vandana
stops.description: Darshan of the various temples on the Kundalpur hills.

stops.name: Chetanoday Tirth, Katni
stops.description: Located 90 kms from Kundalpur Bade Baba.

stops.name: Shri Parshwanath Jinalay, Bilhari
stops.description: Located 13 kms from Katni.

stops.name: Bahoriband Atishay Kshetra
stops.description: Located 33 kms from Bilhari, this place has a large Shantinath idol.

stops.name: Sammed Giri Tirth, Gosalpur
stops.description: Located 40 kms from Bahoriband.

stops.name: Panagar Atishay Kshetra
stops.description: Located 18 kms from Gosalpur and 20 kms from Jabalpur.

title: Mandargiri & Sravanabelgola Circuit
author: Chirag Jain
description: A relaxed 2-day trip highlighting Mandargiri architecture and Sravanabelgola.

stops.name: Mandargiri Hill
stops.description: Located 80 kms from Bangalore. Features a unique Samosharan temple and a scenic lake viewpoint on the hill (you can either climb or use your vehicle). On the base, there is a 21 feet monolithic idol of Shri Chandraprabhu Swamy and a pichhi shaped guru mandir.

stops.name: Assam Bhavan, Sravanabelgola
stops.description: 120 kms from Mandargiri. Comfortable stay with AC rooms available. Can also go for 'Vidyanand Nilaya' for a cheaper stay or in case if this dharmshala is full. Bhojanshala is located near jain mutt temple.

stops.name: Chandragiri Hill, Sravanabelgola
stops.description: Site of 15 ancient temples, the Samadhi cave of Acharya Bhadrabahu and charan of Muni Chandragupta.

stops.name: Vindhyagiri Hill, Sravanabelgola
stops.description: Home to the popular massive monolithic idol of Bahubali Swamy, built during the 10th century.

stops.name: Jain Mutt Temple
stops.description: Darshan, followed by lunch at the nearby Bhojanshala. There are 4-5 more temples in the town.

stops.name: Jinnathpuram
stops.description: An ancient Jain pilgrimage site, just 2 kms from Sravanabelgola. 2 temples - Shri Parshwanath Basadi and Shri Shantinath Basadi are located here.

stops.name: Kambadahalli Jain Mutt
stops.description: Located 20 kms from Sravanabelgola, a 2000-year-old temple complex and gurukul run by the trust for young kids.

stops.name: Shri Paras Dham Atishay Kshetra
stops.description: Located just 24 kms from Kambadahalli, on the way to bangalore.

title: Hyderabad & Kulcharam Pilgrimage
author: Chirag Jain
description: An exploration of ancient and historic Jain temples in the Hyderabad region.

stops.name: Aghapura Jain Temple, Hyderabad
stops.description: Houses a 4th-era idol of Shri Chandraprabhu Bhagwan.

stops.name: Shri Kalikund Parshwanath, Hathnoora
stops.description: 72 kms from Hyderabad. An 800-year-old temple. The ancient idol was found from a local pond.

stops.name: Jogipet Jain Temple
stops.description: Located 30 kms from Hathnoora, this is a 150 years old temple.

stops.name: Shri Vighnahar Parshwanath, Kulcharam
stops.description: 25 kms from Jogipet, this significant Atishay Kshetra features a 9th-century, 11-foot-3-inch black stone idol of Bhagwan Parshvanath in a standing posture.

title: Bangalore to Hyderabad Heritage Trail
author: Chirag Jain
description: A cross-state journey to the birthplace of the legendary Acharya Kunda Kunda.

stops.name: Penukonda Jain Temples
stops.description: 150 kms from bangalore, penukonda features three significant ancient Jain temples - the Pachhe Parshwanath temple being one of them famous for green stone idol of Shree Parshwanath Bhagwan.

stops.name: Konda Kunda, Konakondla
stops.description: 140 kms from Penukonda, this is the sacred birthplace of Acharya Kunda Kunda. Also features a 1,700-year-old rock carving depicting the ancient “Jambudweep”, a cosmic map of the Jain universe. You can catch train to Hyderabad from Guntakal railway station, which is 6 kms from here or drive to Hyderabad (340 kms).
